result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Phillip J White was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must attend Victim Impact Panel on 12/9/14 at 7:00 p.m. at Mid-State Technical College in Wisconsin Rapids.

10:33 Defendant Phillip J White by video from Wood County Jail.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions jail personnel regarding defendant's medical condition. Jail requests that defendant be released from custody and returned two weeks after surgery. State has no objection.
Court grants furlough immediately and report back to jail on June 17, 2015, at 12:00 p.m. Court reminds defendant that absolute sobriety is a condition of release.

10:18 Defendant Phillip J White in court with attorney Ryan D Lister.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Letter Brief from Atty. Lister
and Witness List (Plaintiff)

9:01 Defendant Phillip J White in court with attorney Ryan D Lister.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds that defendant was using evasive actions. Court does not find it was an arrest, but a temporary detention. Court finds it was reasonable to not do field sobriety tests at scene. Court denies motion to dismiss and evidence obtained at Grand Rapids Police Department can be used. Attorney Lister asks for clarification. Discovery is discussed.
Attorney Dominguez
Attorney Lister
for Motion Hearing held July 23, 2014.  (Brenda J. Bertram, Court Reporter)

9:10 Defendant Phillip J White in court with attorney Ryan D Lister.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
David Drinkwine is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Dominguez. He is a police officer with the Town of Grand Rapids. He states on 3/9/14, he was on patrol and conducted a traffic stop on a vehicle driven by the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. The stop was initiated for speeding and he activated his lights. Vehicle did not immediately stop and made an abrupt turn. Testifies as to events after the stop. He observed an odor of intoxicants coming from defendant. Defendant declined to submit to requested field sobriety tests. Defendant declined to submit to PBT. He arrested defendant for OWI and read him Informing the Accused form. He agreed to blood test. 
Attorney Lister cross-examines witness. Exhibit #1, GRPD Offense Report, is marked and reviewed with witness. 
9:42 Attorney Dominguez redirects. 
9:43 Attorney Lister cross-examines witness. 
9:44 Attorney Lister makes statement. 
9:53 Attorney Dominguez makes statement.
10:00 Attorney Lister makes rebuttal statement.
10:02 Court will give State opportunity to review recited case law and prepare brief, as defendant's motion was filed today. Trial date will remain on as scheduled. Ruling will be given on PTC on 8/1/14. Both parties must submit briefs by 4:30 on 7/29/14.

Hearing on June 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Exhibits 1-3

3:03 Defendant Phillip J White in court with attorney Ryan D Lister.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Adam Drinkwine is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lehn. He is an officer with the Grand Rapids Police Department. He states on 3/9/14 he attempted to stop a vehicle because of a speeding violation. He vehicle eventually stopped and he identified the driver as the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He states that the defendant had an odor of intoxicants and had slurred speech and bloodshot eyes. He placed defendant under arrest and he did submit to blood test at Riverview Hospital. Exhibits #1 & 2 are marked and reviewed with witness. Defendant had blood alcohol content of .281. Defendant's driving record shows defendant has 5 prior convictions for OWI.
Attorney Lister cross-examines witness. Exhibit #3 is marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibits are received.
Attorney Lister makes statement.
Attorney Lehn makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
